intro: Tetraneuris scaposa var. scaposa, commonly known as the narrowleaf tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. The species is often found in open grasslands and along canyon walls.
